channel.title: Setup | Pharmer on Tools for running HashiCorp Vault on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in Setup | Pharmer on Tools for running HashiCorp Vault on Kubernetes

item.title: Install Kubeform
item.description: New to Pharmer? Please start here. Installation Guide Download pre-built binaries: Linux i386 Linux amd64 Linux arm64 Mac amd64 Linux amd64 $ curl -LO https://cdn.appscode.com/binaries/pharmer/0.3.1/pharmer-linux-amd64 $ chmod +x pharmer-linux-amd64 $ sudo mv pharmer-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/pharmer Feel free to leave off sudo mv pharmer /usr/local/bin if you would like to add pharmer to your path manually. Linux i368 $ curl -LO https://cdn.appscode.com/binaries/pharmer/0.3.1/pharmer-linux-386 $ chmod +x pharmer-linux-386 $ sudo mv pharmer-linux-386 /usr/local/bin/pharmer Feel free to leave off sudo mv pharmer /usr/local/bin if you would like to add pharmer to your path manually.

item.title: Table of Contents | Setup
item.description: Setup Setup contains instructions for installing Pharmer to provision and manage Kubernetes clusters. Install Pharmer. Installation instructions for Pharmer. Uninstall Pharmer. Instructions for uninstalling Pharmer. Developer Guide Overview. Outlines everything you need to know from setting up your dev environment to how to build and test Pharmer. Release process. Steps for releasing a new version of Pharmer.

item.title: Uninstall Pharmer
item.description: New to Pharmer? Please start here. Uninstallation Guide You can uninstall pharmer by removing pharmer binary from your $PATH $ sudo rm $(which pharmer)
